coll: Pastedown, Quire 1: 1x8 (8), Quire 2: 1x6+1+1 (16), Quire 3: 1x8 (24), Quire 4: 1x8 (32), Quire 5: 1+1x4+1 (38), Quire 6: 1x2+1x6+1+1x4+1 (46), Quire 7, 1x10 (62), Quire 8: undetermined (80), Quire 9: 1x14 (96), Quire 10: 1x14 (110), Quire 11: 1x12 (122), Quire 12: 1x14+1+1 (138), Quire 13: 8x1 (146), Quire 14: undetermined (169), Quire 15: undetermined (185), Quire 16: undetermined (195), Quire 17: 1x8 (203), Quire 18: 1x6+1 (210), pastedown

location.repository: St. Catherine's Monastery of the Sinai

note.value: Ff. 124-129, 132-137, 147-195 are paper, the rest are parchment

Leather on wood, decorated with tooling; holes on covers and along edges (for metal reinforcements); leather fastening strap on top cover | Front cover only attached at top, spine broken, outer edge of back cover missing
Quire structure difficult to establish, due to missing folios, frequency of single-folios, and tight binding
Quire signatures (with gaps) in Georgian, beginning with 3 (fol. 1), ending with 27 (fol. 204); these signatures differ from quire structure given above

program.label: Sinai Palimpests Project
program.description: Described as part of the Sinai Palimpsests Project (2006-2017). The Sinai Palimpsests Project was sponsored by St. Catherine’s Monastery of the Sinai in partnership with the Early Manuscripts Electronic Library and the UCLA Library, and with funding from Arcadia. The Project provides scholarly identification and description of the undertext objects in a subset of palimpsested manuscripts in the Sinai collection, with minimal metadata for the overtexts of the host manuscripts.

program.label: Sinai Palimpests Project
program.description: Imaged as part of the Sinai Palimpsests Project (2006-2017). Digitization for the Sinai Palimpsests Project was sponsored by St. Catherine’s Monastery of the Sinai in partnership with the Early Manuscripts Electronic Library and the UCLA Library, and with funding from Arcadia. The Sinai Palimpsests Project aimed to provide multispectral images of the Undertext Objects in a subset of palimpsested manuscripts in the Sinai collection, as such images may only be available for palimpsested folios.
program.imaging_system: Preservation Book Cradle by Stokes Imaging
note: Automated processing techniques combine two or more raw images into a single processed image by simple arithmetic.

Imaging scientists will review the raw images and manually apply other image processing methods to recover the erased layer of the more intractable palimpsest folios. Manual methods analyze the ensemble of spectral differences obtained from multiple illumination modalities in order to increase the legibility of the erased text.

image_provenance.rights: Contact the Monastery of St. Catherine's of the Sinai.
